title: John Burnet of Barns: A Romance
author: Buchan, John
snippet: The way was over the Wormel and the Logan Burnhills as far as Kingledoors.

title: John Burnet of Barns: A Romance
author: Buchan, John
snippet: But as I stayed there desire came violently upon me to godown to the fair green haughlands about the Holmes Water, which is astream which rises not far off the Kingledoors burn, but which flowsmore to the north and enters Tweed in the strath of Drummelzier notabove a few miles from Barns itself and almost at the door of Dawyck.

title: John Burnet of Barns: A Romance
author: Buchan, John
snippet: By this time I was on a little plateau, near the great black hill ofCoomb Dod, a place whence three streams flow--the Camps Water and theCoulter Water to the Clyde, and the burn of Kingledoors to Tweed.
